textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Tia from Converse, TX 10/13/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 6 out of 6 people found this review useful. 2 of 78 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Commuters should join the commuter student association. Different groups for different majors. If you choose nursing, keep up with your grades because it is very competitive. Tips for prospective students Get a tutor early in the semester. Try to find something to get involved in. You determine how your year will be. Do not take early morning classes, they will catch up with you. Get to know fellow students and your professors. Bang for the buck The tuition is pretty low (around $3000 a semester) which is a big plus for the school. Am enjoying being here I am still trying to find things to get into because I am a commuter, but
